Carly's eyes filled with tears as the dusty bus drove down a dirt road in southern Vietnam.The 14-year-old girl and her   [MASK]   had traveled by plane from Canton, Ohio, to Ho Chi Minh City and then by bus deep into the Mekong Delta.Now, as they reached the village, hundreds of cheering   schoolchildren   lined the entrance to the Hoa Lac School, a two-story building that Carly had   raised   money for,
When Carly was eight,she started   helping   others by giving Thanksgiving baskets in the church to families in need.It was a snowy day,   and   she saw that one girl was wearing only a shirt and that others didn't have   warm   coats.The next November, she went door to door   asking for   uesed coats, hats, gloves, and scarves,and then   handed   them out with the baskets. indeed conquer all the problems that had troubled me.She spent hours every day  teaching  me everything I needed to know, determined to help me learn. [SEP] easily

The results showed   [MASK]   differences: the group with high working memory scored about 10 percent higher than the others on the low-pressure practice test. [SEP] significant
But the two groups'   [MASK]   were about equal on the other test when the pressure was higher. [SEP] scores
The study shows how memory performance is   [MASK]   by fear of failure and the ticking clock, according to the scientists. [SEP] affected
Valentine's Day is a popular festival of love and romance.There are  [MASK]  legends associated with the festival along with the belief that birds began to mate from this day. [SEP] various
Historians trace its  [MASK]  to an ancient Roman festival. [SEP] origin
It is said that in ancient Rome, people  [MASK]  a holiday on February 14th to honor Juno--the Queen of Roman Gods and Goddesses. [SEP] observed

On the following day, February 15th,the festival of Lupercalia was celebrated to honor the Roman God of Agriculture.An interesting  [MASK]  was followed on the festival of Lupercalia to bring together young boys and girls who otherwise were strictly  separated  . [SEP] custom
An interesting  custom  was followed on the festival of Lupercalia to bring together young boys and girls who otherwise were strictly  [MASK]  . [SEP] separated

On the eve of the festival, names of young Roman girls were written on a slip of paper and placed into jars.Each young man  drew out  a girl's name from the jar and was paired with the girl during the festival.Sometimes the  [MASK]  lasted for a year until next year's celebration. [SEP] pairing
Quite often,the couple would fall in love with each other and  [MASK]  marry. [SEP] finally
The custom lasted for a long time until people felt that it was un-Christian and that mates should be chosen by sight, not  [MASK]  . [SEP] luck

The pairing of young boys and girls set the mood of the Valentine's Day Festival as we know today.But it was  [MASK]  due to the efforts and daring of a priest St Valentine that the festival got its  name  and clearer meaning. [SEP] actually
But it was  actually  due to the efforts and daring of a priest St Valentine that the festival got its  [MASK]  and clearer meaning. [SEP] name

The story goes that Emperor Claudius II of Rome found it  [MASK]  to get soldiers and felt the reason why men did not join the  army  was that they did not wish to leave their wives and families. [SEP] tough

The story goes that Emperor Claudius II of Rome found it  tough  to get soldiers and felt the reason why men did not join the  [MASK]  was that they did not wish to leave their wives and families. [SEP] army
As a result, Claudius cancelled all marriages and engagements in Rome.St Valentine challenged Claudius's  [MASK]  order and secretly married couples. [SEP] unjustified

It was the district sports meet.My foot still hadn't healed from a(n)  [MASK]  injury. [SEP] earlier

I turned around and  [MASK]  enough, the boys were preparing for their race. [SEP] sure

Once a young man, a horse trainer's son, was dreaming of owning a horse ranch  of his own though his family wasn't rich.When he was a senior, he was asked to write a   [MASK]  about what he wanted to be and do when he grew up.That night he wrote a seven-page paper  describing  his goal.He wrote it in great   detail  and he even drew a  picture  of a 200-acre ranch, showing the location of all the buildings, the stables  and the track.But two days later he   received  his paper back with a large red   F  on the front page and a note that reads, "See me after   class  ."
The boy with the   dream  went to see the teacher after class and asked, "Why did I get an F?" The teacher said, "This is an unrealistic dream for a   poor  young boy like you.You come from a family with no resources.Owning a horse ranch   requires  lot of money.There's no   way  you could ever do it." Then the teacher added, "If you will   rewrite  this paper with a more realistic goal, I will reconsider your grade."
The boy went home and   thought   about it long and hard.He asked his   father  what he should do.His father said, "Look, son, you have to  make up  your own mind on this.However, I think it is a very important  decision  for you." Finally, the boy turned in the same paper making no   changes   at all.He stated, "You can keep the F and I'll keep my dream." Years later, the boy   realized   his dream. [SEP] paper

Just recently I had been wondering if there was much point in doing little acts of kindness.So often they get  [MASK]  , and occasionally they come back to bite you! [SEP] ignored
Then, just last week, after a long travel, I found myself  [MASK]  at a bus station. [SEP] delayed
The bus was four hours late!So, I guess I wasn't in a good  [MASK]  . [SEP] mood
That's when a woman asked me if I had any spare  [MASK]  to help her get a bus ticket. [SEP] change
"Oh, sure," I said sarcastically ."How much would you like?" As I spoke, I mentally kicked myself for my  [MASK]  and reached into my bag for some money. [SEP] attitude

Every decision is made within a decision environment, which is defined as the collection of information, alternatives, values.Many decision makers have a(n)  [MASK]  to seek more information than required to make a good decision. [SEP] tendency

* A  [MASK]  *  Information  overload will occur. [SEP] delay
* A  delay  *  [MASK]  overload will occur. [SEP] Information

In this state, so much information is available that decision-making ability actually  declines  because the information in its entirety can no longer be managed or assessed  [MASK]  . [SEP] appropriately
A major problem caused by information overload is  [MASK]  . [SEP] forgetfulness

When too much information is taken into memory, especially in a short period of time, some of the information (often that received early on) will be pushed out.*Selective use of the information will occur.That is to say  , the decision maker will choose from among all the information available only those facts which support a preconceived solution or position.*Mental fatigue occurs, which  results in  slower work or poor quality work.*  [MASK]  fatigue occurs, where the decision maker tires of making decisions. [SEP] Decision

Often the result is fast, careless decisions or no decisions are made at all.The quantity of information that can be processed by the human mind is limited.Unless information is  [MASK]  selected, processing will be biased toward the first part of the information received. [SEP] consciously

I came to India in February 2012 to complete a volunteer practicum requirement with some friends.It was really an unforgettable experience!Before we set off, I thought it would be a hard job,   [MASK]   that I could not adapt to the poor living conditions. [SEP] worrying

There we were   responsible   for the Child Development Program and over the course we   [MASK]   two studies related to child work and child rights. [SEP] conducted
We focused on the experiences of the children who were working and the   [MASK]   that pushed them into work. [SEP] causes
The experience was entirely new for me and I learned so much through the   [MASK]  . [SEP] process
The best part of the work, however, was   [MASK]   being in the communities and interacting with the children and their parents. [SEP] simply
I was   [MASK]   to a way of life completely different from my own. [SEP] exposed
In spite of the poor living situations, people in Jaipur were   [MASK]  . [SEP] cheerful
We found that the parents communicated openly with each other and they were always   [MASK]   to share their own thoughts and feelings with their children. [SEP] willing
I could   [MASK]   that people in Jaipur have positive relationships with their family and community members. [SEP] sense
Talking with the people there and hearing their stories was something that had a strong effect on my worldview, continuing to   [MASK]   how I understand everything around me now. [SEP] influence
I have been   [MASK]   by the people that I met through this experience. [SEP] inspired
On the weekends I spent time in Jaipur,   [MASK]   the city and shopping. [SEP] exploring
We were   [MASK]   enough to be there during Holi, an exciting and color1ful celebration in February end or early March in India! [SEP] lucky
We really   [MASK]   every minute of the life in Jaipur! [SEP] valued
Generally, my practicum experience with Volunteering India was extremely   [MASK]  . [SEP] positive
I know that I will be thinking about everything that I saw, learned and   [MASK]   in India and look forward to the day that I can return to this amazing country. [SEP] experienced

Mother used to ask me what the most important part of the body is.Through the years I would  [MASK]  a guess at what I thought was the correct  answer  .When I was younger,I thought sound was very important to us as humans,  therefore  I said,"My ears,Mommy." She said,"No,many people are  deaf  ." Since making my first attempt,I had considered the correct answer carefully.So several  years  later,I told her,"Mommy,  sight  is very important to everybody,so it must be our  eyes  ."She looked at me and told me,"You are learning fast,but the answer is not correct because there are many people who are blind." Over the years,Mother asked me a couple more times and always her answer was  the same  .Then last year,my grandpa died.Everybody was  hurt  .When it was our turn to say our final  goodbye  to Grandpa,my Mom asked me,"Have you found the answer to my usual question--what is the most important body part  yet  ,my son?" I was  shocked  when she asked me this now.I always thought this was a game between her and me.She saw the  confusion  on my face and told me,"This question is very important.It shows that you have really lived your life.For every part you gave me  in the past  ,I have told you were wrong and I have given you an example  why  .But today is the day you need to learn this important lesson." She looked down at me as only a mother can.I saw her eyes well up with tears.She said,"Son,the most important body part is your  shoulder  ." I asked,"Is it because it holds up my head?" She replied,"No,it is because it can hold the head of a friend or a loved one when they cry.Everybody needs a shoulder to  cry  on sometime in life,my son.I only hope that you have enough love and friends that you will always have a shoulder to cry on when you  need  it." Then and there I knew the most important body part is not a selfish one--it is sympathetic to the  pain  of others.People will forget what you said.People will forget what you did.But people will  never  forget how you made them feel. [SEP] make

She said,"No,many people are  deaf  ." Since making my first attempt,I had considered the correct answer carefully.So several  years  later,I told her,"Mommy,  sight  is very important to everybody,so it must be our  eyes  ."She looked at me and told me,"You are learning fast,but the answer is not correct because there are many people who are blind." Over the years,Mother asked me a couple more times and always her answer was  the same  .Then last year,my grandpa died.Everybody was  hurt  .When it was our turn to say our final  goodbye  to Grandpa,my Mom asked me,"Have you found the answer to my usual question--what is the most important body part  [MASK]  ,my son?" I was  shocked  when she asked me this now.I always thought this was a game between her and me.She saw the  confusion  on my face and told me,"This question is very important.It shows that you have really lived your life.For every part you gave me  in the past  ,I have told you were wrong and I have given you an example  why  .But today is the day you need to learn this important lesson." She looked down at me as only a mother can.I saw her eyes well up with tears.She said,"Son,the most important body part is your  shoulder  ." I asked,"Is it because it holds up my head?" She replied,"No,it is because it can hold the head of a friend or a loved one when they cry.Everybody needs a shoulder to  cry  on sometime in life,my son.I only hope that you have enough love and friends that you will always have a shoulder to cry on when you  need  it." Then and there I knew the most important body part is not a selfish one--it is sympathetic to the  pain  of others.People will forget what you said.People will forget what you did.But people will  never  forget how you made them feel. [SEP] yet

Once upon a time there lived a poor man named Malcolm who hunted for his food.One warm spring day, Malcolm had been  [MASK]  for many hours, and he was hot and tired and hungry. [SEP] hunting
He hadn't  [MASK]  even a mouse. [SEP] caught
When he came upon a big tree, he sat down under its  [MASK]  to rest. [SEP] shade

Suddenly he found a big ostrich egg beside the tree.He  picked up  the egg and carried it back to his hut .The egg was so white and round, pure and beautiful that he couldn't  [MASK]  eating it. [SEP] imagine
So he put the egg on the table and went to sleep.The next morning when he woke up, he was  [MASK]  to find bread and soup on his table. [SEP] amazed
He was so hungry, so he tore off a piece and ate it."I've never  [MASK]  anything so delicious," he said aloud. [SEP] tasted
Then he heard a voice answer, "It's bread and soup I've made for you." He turned to find a beautiful woman standing beside the ostrich egg,  [MASK]  was cracked wide open. [SEP] which
"Malcolm, you are a kind and generous man, and I will make you  [MASK]  for the rest of your life. [SEP] happy
[MASK]  me and I will always make delicious food for you." "How can this be? [SEP] Marry
An ostrich egg's  [MASK]  cannot speak or cook or marry me," he said. [SEP] daughter
"I will make you happy, Malcolm," she said, "You must  [MASK]  only this: you will never call me the daughter of an ostrich egg." "I promise," Malcolm said. [SEP] promise
And so they got married.For many years they lived  [MASK]  great happiness. [SEP] in
His wife brought him  [MASK]  , goats and made him a chief. [SEP] cattle
But one day, Malcolm got so  [MASK]  that he was not  satisfied  with what he had. [SEP] greedy
But one day, Malcolm got so  greedy  that he was not  [MASK]  with what he had. [SEP] satisfied
He quarreled with his  [MASK]  . [SEP] wife
He said his wife was the daughter of an ostrich egg...And  in a flash  he was alone again, living in his hut,  [MASK]  his old clothes. [SEP] wearing
There were no cattle, no goats and no wife.He understood that he had been  [MASK]  to let greed and anger get the better of him and to break his promise to his wife. [SEP] mistaken
In the clinic, I asked if Michael could be retested, so the specialist tested him again.To my  [MASK]  , it was the same score. [SEP] disappointment
Later that evening, I  [MASK]  told Frank what I had learned that day. [SEP] tearfully
After talking it over, we agreed that we knew our son much better than an IQ test.We decided that Michael's score must have been a  [MASK]  and we should treat him  naturally  as usual. [SEP] mistake

We moved to Indiana in 1962, and Michael studied at Concordia High School in the same year, he got  [MASK]  grades in the school, especially in biology and chemistry, which was a great comfort. [SEP] good
Michael  [MASK]  Indiana University in 1965 as a pre-medical student. [SEP] entered
Soon afterwards, his teacher permitted him to take more courses than  [MASK]  . [SEP] required
In 1968, he was accepted by the School of Medicine, Yale University.On graduation day in 1972, Frank and I  [MASK]  the ceremony at Yale. [SEP] attended
After the ceremony, we told Michael about the  [MASK]  IQ score he got when he was six. [SEP] low

Since that day, Michael sometimes would look at us and say  [MASK]  , "My dear mom and dad never told me that I couldn't be a doctor, not until after I graduated from medical school!" It is his special way of thanking us for the  confidence  we had in him. [SEP] jokingly

Since that day, Michael sometimes would look at us and say  jokingly  , "My dear mom and dad never told me that I couldn't be a doctor, not until after I graduated from medical school!" It is his special way of thanking us for the  [MASK]  we had in him. [SEP] confidence
Interestingly, Michael then asked for another IQ test.We went to the same clinic where he had  [MASK]  the test eighteen years before. [SEP] received
This time Michael scored 126, an increase of 36 points.A result like that was supposed to be  [MASK]  . [SEP] impossible
Children often do as well as what adults, particularly parents and teachers,  [MASK]  of them. [SEP] expect
That is, tell a child he is "  [MASK]  , and he may play the role of a foolish child. [SEP] stupid

In 1977, a dead author of detective stories saved the life of a 19-month-old baby in a most unusual way.The author was Agatha Christie, one of the most successful writers of detective stories in the world.In June 1977, a baby girl became seriously ill in Qatar, near Saudi Arabia.Doctors were unable to  [MASK]  the cause of her illness, so she  was flown  to London and admitted to Hammersmith Hospital, where specialist help was  available  . [SEP] diagnose
Doctors were unable to  diagnose  the cause of her illness, so she  was flown  to London and admitted to Hammersmith Hospital, where specialist help was  [MASK]  . [SEP] available

She was then only half-conscious and on the "Dangerously Ill" list.A team of doctors hurried to  examine  the baby only to discover that they,  [MASK]  , were puzzled by the very unusual symptoms. [SEP] too
While they were discussing the baby's case, a nurse asked to  [MASK]  to them. [SEP] speak
"Excuse me," said nurse Marsha Maitland, "  [MASK]  I think the baby is  suffering  from thallium poisoning." "  What  makes you think that?" Dr. [SEP] but

"Thallium poisoning is extremely  rare  ." "A few days ago, I was reading a novel called  [MASK]  Agatha Christie," Nurse Maitland explained. [SEP] by
"In the book, somebody uses thallium poison, and  all  the symptoms are  [MASK]  . [SEP] described

They are exactly the same as the baby's." "You're very observant and you may be right," another doctor said."We'll  carry out  some tests and find out  [MASK]  it's thallium or not." The  tests  showed that the baby had  indeed  been poisoned by thallium, a rare metal used in making optical glass. [SEP] whether

The  tests  showed that the baby had  [MASK]  been poisoned by thallium, a rare metal used in making optical glass.Once  they knew the cause of illness, the doctors were able to give the correct treatment.The baby soon  recovered  and was sent back to Qatar.Inquiries showed that the poison  might have come  from an insecticide used in Qatar. It's just a small, white envelope stuck among the branches of our Christmas tree.No name, no identification.It all began because my husband Mike hated Christmas.He didn't hate the true meaning of Christmas, but the commercial aspects.Knowing this, one year I  [MASK]  to reach for something special just for Mike. [SEP] decided
The  [MASK]  came in an unusual way. [SEP] inspiration
Our son Kevin, who was 12 that year, attended a wrestling match against a team sponsored by an inner-city church shortly  [MASK]  Christmas. [SEP] before
These youngsters' sneakers were in  [MASK]  and the shoestrings seemed to be the only thing holding them  together  , compared to our boys' gold uniforms and shoes. [SEP] rags
These youngsters' sneakers were in  rags  and the shoestrings seemed to be the only thing holding them  [MASK]  , compared to our boys' gold uniforms and shoes. [SEP] together
I was even shocked to find they had no helmets.Mike, seated beside me,  [MASK]  his head sadly, "I wish just one of them could have won," he said. [SEP] shook
"They have a lot of potential, but losing could take their dreams away." That's when the idea for his  [MASK]  came. [SEP] present
That afternoon, I went to a local sports store and bought some wrestling helmets and  [MASK]  and sent them anonymously  to the inner-city  church  . [SEP] shoes
That afternoon, I went to a local sports store and bought some wrestling helmets and  shoes  and sent them anonymously  to the inner-city  [MASK]  . [SEP] church
On Christmas Eve, I placed the envelope on the tree, the note  [MASK]  telling Mike what I had done and that this was his gift from me. [SEP] inside
His smile was the brightest thing about Christmas that year.For each Christmas, I  [MASK]  the tradition. [SEP] followed

The envelope became the most exciting part of our Christmas.It was always the  [MASK]  thing opened on Christmas morning and our children, ignoring their unwrapped   new toys, would stand with wide-eyed  expectation  as their dad lifted the envelope from the tree to exhibit its  contents  . [SEP] last

It was always the  last  thing opened on Christmas morning and our children, ignoring their unwrapped   new toys, would stand with wide-eyed  [MASK]  as their dad lifted the envelope from the tree to exhibit its  contents  . [SEP] expectation

It was always the  last  thing opened on Christmas morning and our children, ignoring their unwrapped   new toys, would stand with wide-eyed  expectation  as their dad lifted the envelope from the tree to exhibit its  [MASK]  . [SEP] contents
As the children grew, the toys  gave way to  more practical presents, but the envelope  [MASK]  lost its temptation. [SEP] never
The story doesn't end there.We lost Mike due to cancer.When Christmas rolled around, I was in  [MASK]  . [SEP] sadness
But Christmas Eve found me placing an envelope on the tree, and in the morning, three more  [MASK]  it. [SEP] joined
Each of our  [MASK]  , had placed an envelope on the tree for their dad. [SEP] children

The tradition has grown and someday will expand further with our grandchildren standing around the tree  [MASK]  as their fathers take down the envelope with expectation.Mike's spirit, like the Christmas spirit, will always be with us. [SEP] watching

A king in Africa had a close friend with whom he had grown up.The friend had a habit of looking at every bad situation that occurred in his life and  [MASK]  , "This is good!" One day the king and his friend were out on a hunting  expedition  . [SEP] remarking
The friend had a habit of looking at every bad situation that occurred in his life and  remarking  , "This is good!" One day the king and his friend were out on a hunting  [MASK]  . [SEP] expedition
The friend would  [MASK]  the guns for the king. [SEP] prepare
But this time he had  [MASK]  done something wrong in preparing one of the guns, for after taking the gun from his friend, the king fired it and his thumb was blown off. [SEP] apparently
Examining the  [MASK]  the friend remarked as usual, "This is good!" to which the king replied, "No, this is NOT good!" and  angrily  imprisoned his friend. [SEP] situation
Examining the  situation  the friend remarked as usual, "This is good!" to which the king replied, "No, this is NOT good!" and  [MASK]  imprisoned his friend. [SEP] angrily
About a year later, the king was hunting in an area where he should have known not to hunt.Cannibals  [MASK]  him and took him to their village. [SEP] caught
They tied his hands, set up a wooden post and  [MASK]  him to it. [SEP] fastened
As they came close to set fire to burn the king, they  [MASK]  that the king was missing a thumb. [SEP] noticed
Being superstitious, they never ate anyone who was less than whole.So  [MASK]  the king, they sent him on his way. [SEP] untying
As he returned home, he was  [MASK]  of the event that had taken his thumb and felt sorry for his treatment of his friend. [SEP] reminded
He went immediately to the  [MASK]  to speak with his friend. [SEP] jail
"You were right," he said, "it was good that my thumb was blown off." Then he  [MASK]  to tell the friend all that had just happened. [SEP] continued
"I feel  [MASK]  for sending you to jail for so long. [SEP] guilty

It was bad for me to do this." "No," his friend replied, "this is good!" "What do you mean?How could it be good that I sent my friend to jail for a year?" "If I had NOT been in jail, I would have been with you, and I would have been  [MASK]  !" [SEP] eaten

The inhalation of asbestos particles is associated with a number of lung diseases, such as asbestosis and  [MASK]  cancer. [SEP] lung

Asbestosis is caused by the entry of asbestos particles into the wall of the alveoli, causing scarring which limits the functioning of the lungs.The lung  [MASK]  its elasticity and may change shape. [SEP] loses

The initial symptoms of asbestosis are a tightness in the chest and breathlessness.In its  [MASK]  stages, sufferers develop the barrel-shaped chests associated with emphysema, cyanosis, (where the skin takes a bluish  color  ) and club fingers. [SEP] later
In its  later  stages, sufferers develop the barrel-shaped chests associated with emphysema, cyanosis, (where the skin takes a bluish  [MASK]  ) and club fingers. [SEP] color
Lung cancer, the generic  [MASK]  for malignant tumors of the alveoli and bronchial tubes, has been shown to be directly  related  to the inhalation of asbestos particles. [SEP] term
Lung cancer, the generic  term  for malignant tumors of the alveoli and bronchial tubes, has been shown to be directly  [MASK]  to the inhalation of asbestos particles. [SEP] related
As in the case of asbestosis, there is generally a period of inactiveness which may  [MASK]  from 25 to 30 years after initial exposure, despite the  absence  of further exposure. [SEP] extend
As in the case of asbestosis, there is generally a period of inactiveness which may  extend  from 25 to 30 years after initial exposure, despite the  [MASK]  of further exposure. [SEP] absence

Research suggests that there is a direct correlation between the degree of exposure to asbestos  and  the incidence of lung cancer.Where exposure occurs, the level of risk is further  [MASK]  by cigarette smoking. [SEP] increased
Asbestos workers who smoke cigarettes have a 90% greater risk of catching lung cancer than workers who do not  [MASK]  . [SEP] smoke

Exposure to blue asbestos has been shown to producemesothelioma, a rare cancer of the outer lining of the lung or pleura.In a normal population the incidence of mesothelioma is extremely  [MASK]  . [SEP] low
Where epidemiological surveys have revealed a higher incidence of the disease, it is almost always related to  [MASK]  exposure. [SEP] asbestos

[MASK]  changes in lung tissue caused by exposure to asbestos are pleural plaques and effusions.The former refer to a thickening of the lining of the chest wall,  whereas  the latter consists of a collection of fluid in the chest region outside the lungs.Pleural plaques commonly remain undiagnosed and generally have no detrimental effect on health. Hearing her husband back, Kay  [MASK]  out of the kitchen, but to her  surprise  , Joe sat still, without  movement  .Usually, when he came back, he would greet her with a kiss or a hug.Immediately Kay  sensed  something unusual.She went over to Joe and asked, "Tell me, my dear, any  bad  news?" "Well, I have to say that things are not in our  favor  .It seems that I have no  chance  to defeat my opponent .He's much more  experienced  , for he's been holding the position for nearly four years, and people think he's done a  good  job.Many signs show that he's in the  lead  ." "Oh, really? [SEP] walked

But I still believe you have our own  [MASK]  .You're in your forties at the best age for a man.You're new, so people have reasons to  expect  you to do better.So let's go to the voters and tell hem, 'Give Joe Hart a chance, and he'll show you who's your better  choice  " Their next three weeks were spent  visiting  different neighborhoods, going to all kinds of parties, and making speeches at universities and gatherings.Even Judy and Julie, their small children, went from door to door,  repeating  their "Please vote for our daddy, Joe Hart!" The night before the  final  vote, the whole Hart family were too  anxious  to fall asleep.The moment before the final result was declared, their  hearts  were brought to their mouths, but at last they all  jumped  and burst into tears. The Making of a Surgeon How does a doctor recognize the point in time when he is finally a "surgeon"?As my year as chief resident drew to a close, I asked myself this question  [MASK]  more than one occasion. [SEP] on

The answer, I concluded, was  [MASK]  .When you can say to yourself, "There is no surgical patient I cannot treat competently, treat just  as well as  or better than any other surgeon"-- then, and not until then, you are  indeed  a surgeon.I was  nearing  that point. [SEP] self-confidence

[MASK]  , for example, the emergency situations that we met almost every night.The first few months of the year I had  feared  the ringing of the telephone.I knew it meant another critical decision to be  made  .Often, after I had told Walt or Larry what to do in a particular  situation  , I'd have trouble getting back to sleep.I'd  review  all the facts of the case and, often, wonder  if  I had made a poor decision.More than once at two or three in the  morning  , after lying awake for an hour, I'd get out of  bed  , dress and drive to the hospital to see the patient myself.It was the only  way  I could find the  peace  of mind I needed to relax.
